newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam's President Anh in hospital.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam's President Anh in hospital.

text.p: Vietnam's President Anh was being treated in a Hanoi hospital on Sunday for blood pressure problems, but there were mixed reports about the severity of his condition.
Medical staff at Hanoi's prestigious 108 Army hospital said the 75-year-old president was being treated there but declined to discuss details of the case.
One government official, who declined to be named, said Anh, 75, was unconscious and suffering haemorrhaging around the brain. He said doctors were having difficulties dealing with his condition.
But others played down the reports. A hospital staff member said Anh had been ill during the past week but was recovering and might be discharged later on Sunday.
General Anh is one of three top leaders in Vietnam and was appointed president in September 1992.
The other members of the collective triumvirate are Party chief Do Muoi, 79, and Prime Minister Vo Van Kiet, 73.
